title: Doug Mastriano
added: On Mastriano's campaign page, he states that "''marriage is between a man and woman -- and that no amount of disinformation or political correctness will change these facts"'' <ref>{{Cite web|title=https://fight4pa.com/|url=https://fight4pa.com/|access-date=2020-07-29|language=en-US}}</ref> Mastriano has also been reluctant to call [[Pennsylvania Department of Health|Pennsylvania Health Secretary]] [[Rachel Levine|Rachael Levine]] by her preferred pronoun, "she", and refuses to acknowledge his political opinion on transgender individuals.

title: Doug Mastriano
deleted: Mastriano had been criticized{{By whom|date=November 2020}} for posts on his campaign's Facebook page, "Doug Mastriano Fighting for Freedom", which draws heavily from right-wing social media and web publications.

In May 2019, during his campaign for state senate, Mastriano was accused of spreading Islamophobia after sharing several posts on his campaign Facebook page targeting Muslims. "Islam wants to kill gay rights, Judaism, Christianity and pacifism" read one of the posts, which critiqued the common "Coexist" bumper stickers.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Hullinger|first=Logan|title=GOP candidate for Alloway's state Senate seat accused of spreading Islamophobia|url=https://www.yorkdispatch.com/story/news/politics/2019/05/07/gop-candidate-alloways-state-senate-seat-accused-spreading-islamophobia/3661917002/|access-date=2020-10-15|website=York Dispatch|language=en-US}}</ref> After the [[Notre-Dame de Paris fire|Notre Dame fire]] Mastriano had shared an image that was circulated in the wake of the fire suggesting that it had been an act by Muslim terrorists.<ref>üñâ{{Cite web|url=https://www.penncapital-star.com/government-politics/conspiratorial-anti-muslim-memes-populate-facebook-page-of-state-senate-candidate/|title=Conspiratorial, anti-Muslim memes populated Facebook page of state Senate candidate|date=May 6, 2019}}</ref> In April 2018, his campaign Facebook page shared an article headlined, ‚ÄúA Dangerous Trend: Muslims running for office.‚Äù<ref>{{Cite web|last=Hardison|first=Elizabeth|date=2019-05-06|title=Conspiratorial, anti-Muslim memes populated Facebook page of state Senate candidate|url=https://www.penncapital-star.com/government-politics/conspiratorial-anti-muslim-memes-populate-facebook-page-of-state-senate-candidate/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-10-15|website=Pennsylvania Capital-Star|language=en-US}}</ref>

While various Democratic critics condemned his Facebook posts, neither Mastriano, the county, nor the state Republican party responded publicly about the issue.<ref name="phobia">{{cite web|last=Hullinger|first=Logan|title=GOP candidate for Alloway's state Senate seat accused of spreading Islamophobia|url=https://www.yorkdispatch.com/story/news/politics/2019/05/07/gop-candidate-alloways-state-senate-seat-accused-spreading-islamophobia/3661917002/|access-date=May 7, 2019|website=York Dispatch|language=en}}</ref>

After Mastriano's election to state senate, the auditor of [[Reading Township, Adams County, Pennsylvania|Reading Township]], located [[Adams County, Pennsylvania|Adams County]] in Mastriano's district, wrote a letter in ''[[The Gettysburg Times]]'' in which he criticized Mastriano with claims such as "Doug's page is active at seemingly every hour of the day", and "Whether it is Doug himself or a staffer running the page, does the Mastriano team not have anything better to do? Why is a full-time elected official spending so much of their time on social media interacting with people they don't represent?" Mastriano did not respond to the auditor's criticism.<ref>{{Cite newspaper|date=August 20, 2019|title=Mastriano should leave Facebook|language=en|newspaper=[[The Gettysburg Times]]|url=http://www.gettysburgtimes.com/opinion/letters_to_editor/article_1630f347-de41-5dc9-84b1-2de0aa5cb779.html|url-access=subscription|access-date=August 21, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Senator Doug Mastriano|url=https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Government-Official/SenatorDougMastriano/videos/|access-date=2020-10-15|website=facebook.com|language=en}}</ref>

title: Doug Mastriano
deleted: In November of 2020, Mastriano mounted a disinformation campaign to support President Donald J Trump's unfounded allegations of voter fraud in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

title: Doug Mastriano
deleted: In November,  2020, Mastriano was the leader of an attempt to circumvent the will of Pennsylvania voters by continuing to reiterate unfounded claims of voter fraud following President Donald Trump's failed re-election bid.

title: Doug Mastriano
deleted: In November 2020, Mastriano led the GOP effort in Pennsylvania to circumvent the will of Pennsylvania voters by reiterating  unfounded claims of voter fraud and polling irregularities despite several courts dismissing the claims as being "without merit."

title: Doug Mastriano
deleted: In the book and in public talks and articles, Mastriano claims that he discovered a [https://providencemag.com/2018/01/serving-god-caesar-sergeant-alvin-york-morality-war/ photograph] that is on the cover of this biography allegedly showing Alvin York escorting German prisoners away from the battlefield. However, the image is available at this [https://catalog.archives.gov/id/86697771 U.S. National Archives] link, and [[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Army_War_College|U.S. Army War College]] and according to the contemporaneous U.S. Signal Corps notes, was taken on September 26, 1918 in a different area, nine days before York's Medal of Honor actions.

title: Doug Mastriano
added: On November 6, Mastriano and two other state senators, [[Michele Brooks]] and [[Scott Hutchinson]], issued a joint memo calling for a full recount "in any counties where state law was broken, regardless of the Department of State‚Äôs instructions, as well as in any precinct where questionable actions were demonstrated."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.yorkdispatch.com/story/news/2020/11/09/state-gop-lawmakers-call-election-audit-after-trumps-fraud-claims/6189591002/ |website=[[York Dispatch]] |first=Lindsey |last=O'Laughlin |date=November 10, 2020 |access-date=November 30, 2020 }}</ref>
